[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19065?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19065?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [35b2aba...6bab9da](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19065?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Just seeing this and https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/11375 now.

In https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/11375#issuecomment-149696766 @jorisvandenbossche mentioned these would be better represented as `DateOffsets`, since there's some debate about whether ISO 8601 durations are relative (DateOffset) or absolute (TimeDelta)

I *think* it's still useful to support this as a format for parsing timedeltas, but we may want to put some warnings / caveats in the documentation.
